title-group.article-title: Subquadratic-Time Factoring of Polynomials over Finite Fields

abstract.p: New probabilistic algorithms are presented for factoring univariate polynomials over finite fields. The algorithms factor a polynomial of degree n over a finite field of constant cardinality in time O (n<sup>1.815</sup>). Previous algorithms required time <tex-math>$\circleddash(n^{2+o(1)}$</tex-math>). The new algorithms rely on fast matrix multiplication techniques. More generally, to factor a polynomial of degree n over the finite field F<sub>q</sub> with q elements, the algorithms use O(n<sup>1.815</sup> log q) arithmetic operations in F<sub>q</sub>. The new "baby step/giant step" techniques used in our algorithms also yield new fast practical algorithms at super-quadratic asymptotic running time, and subquadratic-time methods for manipulating normal bases of finite fields.

p.mixed-citation: A preliminary version of this paper appears in the Proc. 27th Annual ACM Symp. Theory of Computing, ACM Press, pp. 398-406 (1995).398 Proc. 27th Annual ACM Symp. Theory of Computing 1995
